clinical_study.brief_title: A Novel Lung Function Imaging Modality as a Preoperative Evaluation Tool (LIME)
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Lung Function Imaging Modality as a Preoperative Evaluation Tool (LIME)

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the correlation between pre-surgical 4DCT-ventilation imaging and post-surgical lung function.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the correlation between pre-surgical 4-Dimensional Computed Tomography-ventilation (4DCT-ventilation) imaging and post-surgical lung function. To determine whether 4DCT-ventilation is a better predictor of post-surgical lung function than nuclear medicine imaging using pulmonary function tests (PFTs). To determine whether 4DCT-ventilation is a better predictor of post-surgical lung function than nuclear medicine imaging using quality of life (QOL) questionnaires. Evaluate cost-effectiveness of using 4DCT-ventialtion and VQ scans for pre-surgical assessment. To use longitudinal (pre and post-surgical) 4DCT-ventilation imaging to derive novel post-surgical prediction formulas.

primary_outcome.measure: The number of patients with pre-surgical 4DCT-ventilation imaging and post-surgical lung function correlation
primary_outcome.description: The correlation between 4DCT-ventilation-based %PPO PFTs and true, post-operative PFTs. The %PPO PFT values are a standard part of a pre-surgical work up and are used to classify patients according to surgical risk categories. %PPO PFTs are calculated by scaling the pre-surgical PFT values by the amount of lung function that will be lost due to surgery; where the amount of lung function lost is estimated from the lung function imaging scan. We will calculate %PPO PFTs with both nuclear medicine VQ scans and 4DCT-ventilation imaging.

arm_group.description: The patient will undergo 4DCT imaging. The 4DCT imaging data along with image processing techniques will be used to generate a 4DCT-ventilation map. All surgical decisions will be based on the current standard of care imaging (VQ scans) and not on the 4DCT imaging results.

intervention.description: 4DCT-ventilation is an imaging modality that provides superior image quality, reduced cost, and a faster imaging procedure compared to nuclear medicine VQ scans.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provision to sign and date the consent form.
2. Stated willingness to comply with all study procedures and be available for the duration of the study.
3. Be a male/female aged 18 to 100.
4. Patient with lung cancer (presumed or biopsy proven) undergoing evaluation for resection
5. Disease clinically staged as T1-4, N0-2, M0-1 (all stages)
6. Lung function imaging required for pre-surgical evaluation at the discretion of the cardiothoracic surgeon.
7. Life expectancy greater than 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients getting a wedge resection
2. Patients who do not require lung function imaging for pre-surgical evaluation at the discretion of the cardiothoracic surgeon.
